content: francesca shawl description francesca shawl is made in a brioche stitch it s an easy but elegant project for long autumn evenings size one size gauge 21 sts needles suggested needles 4 5 mm us 7 / 80 cm 32-40 circular needles suggested yarn option 1 pascuali option 2 knitting for olive option 3 filcolana saf�ra 75% mulesing-free merino 100 % non-mulesed anina 100% merino virgin wool 25% silk = merino wool = approx 200g superwash = approx approx 200g 200g held together with held together with held together with soft silk mohair 25 g ~ 225m mohair bliss 25 g ~ 300m = approx 100g tilia 25g ~ 210m = = approx 75g approx 100g or 2 strands of knitting for olive merino = approx 400g option 4 lamana milano 90% wool 10% cashmere = approx 125g held together with premia 25 g ~ 300m = approx 150g *work with 3 strands notions tapestry needle blocking tools scissors abbreviations k - knit k1tbl - knit one through the back loop k2tog - knit two sts together sl1 wyif - slip one stitch purlwise with yarn held in front st s - stitch es yo - yarn over rs - right side ws - wrong side edge stitches always slip the �rst stitch purlwise with yarn held in front sl1 wyif and always knit the last stitch tubular k1tbl pattern cast on 62 sts with a cable cast on method on 4 5 mm us 7 needles set-up row sl1 wyif *k1 sl1 wyif yo* repeat *-* to the last stitch k1tbl row 1 sl1 wyif *k2tog sl1 wyif yo* repeat *-* to the last stitch k1tbl repeat row 1 on both sides rs and ws till you use all the yarn you have leaving approx 140 cm 1 5 yard for bind off finishing bind off your shawl using an elastic bind-off method for brioche remember to block your �nished garment and dry it �at on knitting mats or towels weave in all ends neatly share your version of francesca shawl on social media with hashtag #francescashawl and tag @lazy nitter pattern and items knitted using this pattern are for personal use only
